intro: Paraphlomis lutienensis, commonly known as the Lutien narrowleaf germander, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically purple or violet, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Paraphlomis lutienensis is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy species found in high-altitude regions.
